name: df-cgr3
params: setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4, setvar s5, setvar s6, setvar s7, setvar s8
body: |- wceq(ccgr3, copab(s0, s1, wrex(s2, cn, wrex(s3, cfv(cee, cv(s2)), wrex(s4, cfv(cee, cv(s2)), wrex(s5, cfv(cee, cv(s2)), wrex(s6, cfv(cee, cv(s2)), wrex(s7, cfv(cee, cv(s2)), wrex(s8, cfv(cee, cv(s2)), w3a(wceq(cv(s0), cop(cv(s3), cop(cv(s4), cv(s5)))), wceq(cv(s1), cop(cv(s6), cop(cv(s7), cv(s8)))), w3a(wbr(cop(cv(s3), cv(s4)), ccgr, cop(cv(s6), cv(s7))), wbr(cop(cv(s3), cv(s5)), ccgr, cop(cv(s6), cv(s8))), wbr(cop(cv(s4), cv(s5)), ccgr, cop(cv(s7), cv(s8))))))))))))))
comment: The three place congruence predicate. This is an abbreviation for saying that all three pair in a triple are congruent with each other. Three place form of Definition 4.4 of [Schwabhauser] p. 35. (Contributed by Scott Fenton, 4-Oct-2013.)
